title: "Lives In West Are Just Too Easy": Ukraine Sees Influx of Western War Tourists
content: Spanish traveller Alberto Blasco Ventas looked out at Ukraine's destroyed Irpin brige, blown up to stop Russian troops in 2022 and now a hotspot for thrill-seeking tourists visiting the country.
summary: Spanish traveller Alberto Blasco Ventas looked out at Ukraine's destroyed Irpin brige, blown up to stop Russian troops in 2022 and now a hotspot for thrill-seeking tourists visiting the country.

title: Israel Appeals Against Arrest Warrant On PM, Says, "If Court Rejects..."
content: Israel today approached the International Criminal Court or ICC to appeal against its order to arrest Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu for "war crimes".
summary: Israel today approached the International Criminal Court or ICC to appeal against its order to arrest Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu for "war crimes".

title: Donald Trump's Cabinet Picks Receive Bomb Threats, FBI Begins Investigation
content: The Federal Bureau of Investigation or FBI is investigating bomb threats received by several of Donald Trump's nominees selected for key roles in his new administration.
summary: The Federal Bureau of Investigation or FBI is investigating bomb threats received by several of Donald Trump's nominees selected for key roles in his new administration.

title: "Need Manpower": US Urges Ukraine To Lower Military Service Age To 18
content: Ukraine should consider lowering the age of military service for its soldiers to 18 years old, a senior US administration official said on Wednesday, putting pressure on Kyiv to bolster its fighting forces in the country's war with Russia.
summary: Ukraine should consider lowering the age of military service for its soldiers to 18 years old, a senior US administration official said on Wednesday, putting pressure on Kyiv to bolster its fighting forces in the country's war with Russia.

title: Russia Expels German Journalists In Tit-For-Tat Move Denied By Berlin
content: Russia said on Wednesday that it would expel one correspondent and one cameraman from Germany's ARD in a symmetrical response to German moves against journalists from Russia's Channel One that Berlin denied undertaking.
summary: Russia said on Wednesday that it would expel one correspondent and one cameraman from Germany's ARD in a symmetrical response to German moves against journalists from Russia's Channel One that Berlin denied undertaking.

title: "Not Born Perverted": Lawyer Of Husband In Gisele Pelicot Mass Rape Case
content: A lawyer for the chief defendant in a French mass rape trial on Wednesday urged the court to recall his good side after prosecutors demanded lengthy jail terms for the dozens of suspects.
summary: A lawyer for the chief defendant in a French mass rape trial on Wednesday urged the court to recall his good side after prosecutors demanded lengthy jail terms for the dozens of suspects.

title: US Says China Has Released 3 "Wrongfully Detained" Americans
content: China has freed three Americans considered wrongfully detained in a swap with the United States, US officials said Wednesday, meeting a key goal of outgoing President Joe Biden's administration.
summary: China has freed three Americans considered wrongfully detained in a swap with the United States, US officials said Wednesday, meeting a key goal of outgoing President Joe Biden's administration.

title: The World's Easiest Places To Buy Citizenship, Here's What It Takes

title: France Says Netanyahu Has 'Immunity' From World Court Arrest Warrants
content: Provisions for immunity from prosecution at the International Criminal Court apply to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, the French foreign ministry said on Wednesday.
summary: Provisions for immunity from prosecution at the International Criminal Court apply to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, the French foreign ministry said on Wednesday.

title: "Always Called For Dialogue, Diplomacy": India On Israel-Lebanon Ceasefire
content: India welcomed the ceasefire deal between Israel and Lebanon saying that the move will help bring peace and stability in West Asia. New Delhi said that it has always recommended the path of diplomacy as the 21st Century is no longer an era for war.
summary: India welcomed the ceasefire deal between Israel and Lebanon saying that the move will help bring peace and stability in West Asia. New Delhi said that it has always recommended the path of diplomacy as the 21st Century is no longer an era for war.

title: Viral Video Shows United Airlines Passenger Violently Attacking Plane Seat
content: A shocking video of a plane passenger violently attacking his chair in flight is going viral on social media.

title: UAE Gets 1st Licensed Lottery With Top Prize At...
content: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has launched its first authorised national lottery, with a jackpot of 100 million dirhams (AED) -- equivalent to $27.2 million -- up for grabs.
summary: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has launched its first authorised national lottery, with a jackpot of 100 million dirhams (AED) -- equivalent to $27.2 million -- up for grabs.

title: Russia Warns US Of 'Spiral Of Escalation' But Says Will Keep Channels Open
content: Russia warned the United States on Wednesday to halt what it called a "spiral of escalation" over Ukraine.
summary: Russia warned the United States on Wednesday to halt what it called a "spiral of escalation" over Ukraine.

title: "Peaceful": Bangladesh Hindu Leader Slams Petition On ISKCON Ban
content: Bangladesh National Hindu Grand Alliance General Secretary, Mrityunjay Kumar Roy on Wednesday, strongly condemned the petition demanding ban on International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) in Bangladesh.
summary: Bangladesh National Hindu Grand Alliance General Secretary, Mrityunjay Kumar Roy on Wednesday, strongly condemned the petition demanding ban on International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) in Bangladesh.

title: Trump Team Weighs Talks With North Korea's Kim In New Diplomatic Push

title: Bangladesh High Court Acquits Ex-PM Khaleda Zia In Corruption Case
content: Bangladesh High Court on Wednesday acquitted former prime minister and BNP Chairperson Khaleda Zia in a corruption case in which she was sentenced to seven years in jail by a lower court, according to media reports.
summary: Bangladesh High Court on Wednesday acquitted former prime minister and BNP Chairperson Khaleda Zia in a corruption case in which she was sentenced to seven years in jail by a lower court, according to media reports.

title: All About Bushra Bibi, Imran Khan's Wife And Central Figure In Pak Protests
content: Pakistan this week saw serious turmoil, with supporters of former Prime Minister Imran Khan defying government lockdowns and violent police opposition to demand the release of jailed Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder.
summary: Pakistan this week saw serious turmoil, with supporters of former Prime Minister Imran Khan defying government lockdowns and violent police opposition to demand the release of jailed Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder.

title: Trump Tariffs: Here's What Gets More Expensive For American Consumers
content: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to slap a 25% tariff on all goods imported from America's largest trading partners - Mexico and Canada, starting January 20, his first day in office.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to slap a 25% tariff on all goods imported from America's largest trading partners - Mexico and Canada, starting January 20, his first day in office.
